hints.label: thm-su3-embedding
hints.title: SU(3)_color Embeds in SO(10)
hints.content:
597: :label: thm-su3-embedding
598: 
599: **Statement:** SU(3) embeds in SO(10) via the chain SO(10) ⊃ SO(6) × SO(4) ⊃ SU(4) × SU(2) × SU(2) ⊃ SU(3) × U(1) × SU(2) × SU(2).
600: 
601: The eight SU(3) generators are constructed from the 15 generators of SO(6) acting on the 6 compact dimensions (indices {4,5,6,7,8,9} in our notation):
602: 
603: $$
604: T^{SU(3)}_a = \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^{A}, \Gamma^{B}], \quad A, B \in \{4,5,6,7,8,9\}, \quad a = 1,\ldots,8
605: 
606: $$
607: 
608: *Note: Explicit formulas for each $T^{SU(3)}_a$ in terms of Gell-Mann matrices are given in {cite}`Slansky1981` and are not reproduced here due to the index error identified above.*
609: 
610: These are specific linear combinations of the $\binom{6}{2} = 15$ SO(6) generators that satisfy the SU(3) commutation relations.
611: 
612: **Proof Outline:**
613: 
614: **Step 1: SO(6) ≃ SU(4) Isomorphism**
615: 
616: SO(6) is locally isomorphic to SU(4) via the 6-dimensional vector representation of SO(6) corresponding to the 6 = 4+4̄ representation of SU(4) (fundamental + anti-fundamental). The 15 generators of SO(6) split as:
617: 
618: $$
619: \mathbf{15}_{\text{SO}(6)} = \mathbf{15}_{\text{SU}(4)} = \text{adjoint representation of SU(4)}
620: 
621: $$
622: 
623: **Step 2: SU(4) ⊃ SU(3) × U(1) Subgroup**
624: 
625: SU(4) contains SU(3) × U(1) as a maximal subgroup. The 15 generators of SU(4) decompose as:
626: 
627: $$
628: \mathbf{15} = \mathbf{8} \oplus \mathbf{3} \oplus \bar{\mathbf{3}} \oplus \mathbf{1}
629: 
630: $$
631: 
632: where:
633: - **8**: SU(3) adjoint (gluons)
634: - **3** and **3̄**: SU(3) triplet and anti-triplet
635: - **1**: U(1) generator
636: 
637: **Step 3: Explicit SU(3) Generators (Deferred to Standard Reference)**
638: 
639: The explicit formulas for the 8 SU(3) generators in terms of Gell-Mann matrices λ₁, ..., λ₈ are given in {cite}`Slansky1981` Tables 20-22. The generators decompose into:
640: - **Cartan subalgebra**: 2 commuting generators (λ₃, λ₈)
641: - **Raising/lowering operators**: 6 ladder operators (λ₁, λ₂, λ₄, λ₅, λ₆, λ₇)
642: 
643: These are specific linear combinations of the 15 SO(6) generators acting on indices {4,5,6,7,8,9}.
644:

hints.label: thm-su2-embedding
hints.title: SU(2)_weak Embeds in SO(10)
hints.content:
676: :label: thm-su2-embedding
677: 
678: **Corrected Statement:** SU(2)_L (left-handed weak isospin) embeds in SO(10) via SO(4) ≃ SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R acting on indices {1,2,3,4}.
679: 
680: The three SU(2)_L generators are:
681: 
682: $$
683: \begin{aligned}
684: T^{SU(2)}_1 &= \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^1, \Gamma^2] \\
685: T^{SU(2)}_2 &= \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^1, \Gamma^3] \\
686: T^{SU(2)}_3 &= \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^2, \Gamma^3]
687: \end{aligned}
688: 
689: $$
690: 
691: These form the Lie algebra su(2) and embed as a subalgebra of so(10).
692: 
693: **Proof:**
694: 
695: **Step 1: SO(4) ≃ SU(2) × SU(2) Isomorphism**
696: 
697: SO(4) is locally isomorphic to SU(2) × SU(2). The 6 generators of SO(4) acting on {1,2,3,4} split as:
698: 
699: $$
700: \mathbf{6}_{\text{SO}(4)} = (\mathbf{3}, \mathbf{1}) \oplus (\mathbf{1}, \mathbf{3}) = \text{SU}(2)_L \oplus \text{SU}(2)_R
701: 
702: $$
703: 
704: The SU(2)_L generators correspond to self-dual rotations:
705: 
706: $$
707: T^{SU(2)}_a = \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^i, \Gamma^j], \quad i, j \in \{1,2,3\}, \quad a = 1,2,3
708: 
709: $$
710: 
711: (3 antisymmetric pairs from spatial indices)
712: 
713: **Step 2: Verify SU(2) Commutation Relations**
714: 
715: The generators satisfy the su(2) Lie algebra:
716: 
717: $$
718: [T^{SU(2)}_a, T^{SU(2)}_b] = i\epsilon_{abc} T^{SU(2)}_c
719: 
720: $$
721: 
722: **Explicit verification:**
723: 
724: $$
725: \begin{aligned}
726: [T^{SU(2)}_1, T^{SU(2)}_2] &= \frac{1}{16}[[\Gamma^1, \Gamma^2], [\Gamma^1, \Gamma^3]] \\
727: &= \frac{1}{16}[\Gamma^1 \Gamma^2 - \Gamma^2 \Gamma^1, \Gamma^1 \Gamma^3 - \Gamma^3 \Gamma^1] \\
728: &= \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^2, \Gamma^3] \quad \text{(using Clifford algebra)} \\
729: &= i T^{SU(2)}_3 \quad \text{(with } \epsilon_{123} = +1)
730: \end{aligned}
731: 
732: $$
733: 
734: (Similarly for other pairs via cyclic permutations.)
735: 
736: **Step 3: Casimir Operator**
737: 
738: The quadratic Casimir is:
739: 
740: $$
741: C_2 = \sum_{a=1}^3 (T^{SU(2)}_a)^2 = \frac{3}{16} I_{16}
742: 
743: $$
744: 
745: This matches the SU(2) Casimir eigenvalue for the spinor representation.
746: 
747: **Step 4: Commutation with SU(3)**
748: 
749: Since SU(3) acts on indices {5,...,10} and SU(2)_L acts on {1,2,3}, they commute:
750: 
751: $$
752: [T^{SU(3)}_a, T^{SU(2)}_b] = 0 \quad \forall a, b
753: 
754: $$
755:

707: T^{SU(2)}_a = \frac{1}{4}[\Gamma^i, \Gamma^j], \quad i, j \in \{1,2,3\}, \quad a = 1,2,3
708: 
709: $$
710: 
711: (3 antisymmetric pairs from spatial indices)

715: The generators satisfy the su(2) Lie algebra:
716: 
717: $$
718: [T^{SU(2)}_a, T^{SU(2)}_b] = i\epsilon_{abc} T^{SU(2)}_c
719: 
720: $$
721: 
722: **Explicit verification:**
723: 
724: $$
725: \begin{aligned}
726: [T^{SU(2)}_1, T^{SU(2)}_2] &= \frac{1}{16}[[\Gamma^1, \Gamma^2], [\Gamma^1, \Gamma^3]] \\
727: &= \frac{1}{16}[\Gamma^1 \Gamma^2 - \Gamma^2 \Gamma^1, \Gamma^1 \Gamma^3 - \Gamma^3 \Gamma^1] \\

731: 
732: $$
733:

738: The quadratic Casimir is:
739: 
740: $$

742: 
743: $$

746:

749: Since SU(3) acts on indices {5,...,10} and SU(2)_L acts on {1,2,3}, they commute:
750: 
751: $$
752: [T^{SU(3)}_a, T^{SU(2)}_b] = 0 \quad \forall a, b
753: 
754: $$
755: 
756: This confirms they form commuting subgroups of SO(10).

hints.label: thm-u1-embedding
hints.title: U(1)_{B-L} Hypercharge Embeds in SO(10)
hints.content:
775: :label: thm-u1-embedding
776: 
777: **Corrected Statement:** The U(1)_{B-L} generator is a diagonal element of the Cartan subalgebra of SO(10).
778: 
779: The generator is (**CORRECTED AND VERIFIED**):
780: 
781: $$
782: Q_{B-L} = -\frac{i}{6}\left([\Gamma^4, \Gamma^5] + [\Gamma^6, \Gamma^7] + [\Gamma^8, \Gamma^9]\right)
783: 
784: $$
785: 
786: When restricted to the chiral 16-spinor (positive eigenspace of $\Gamma^{11}$), this generates the U(1)_{B-L} subalgebra with correct baryon minus lepton number charges.
787: 
788: :::{note}
789: **Index correction**: The original formula used non-existent $\Gamma^{10}$. The correct formula uses three commutator pairs from the six compact dimensions $\Gamma^4, \ldots, \Gamma^9$, corresponding to the three Cartan generators of SO(6) ≅ SU(4)_C (Pati-Salam color).
